intro: Solanum angulosum, commonly known as the angular nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring angular, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into berries, which are toxic to humans and animals. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other toxic and economically important plants. Solanum angulosum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
